page.title: 05 CRANSLEY FARM
page.content: To the NE of Fowlis Easter there is a relatively large farm called Cransley.It is mainly a mixed farm containing sheep, poultry, potatoes, cereals, fruit farming and oil seed rape. There was once a routeway leading from Cransley,remains of which can still be seen,to an old drove road which local herdsmen used to drive cattle from surrounding farms to market sales.This drove road called the LOGAN ( which means rocking stone)is now overgrown with wild grasses. It was a very important communication channel in its day from this area to Coupar Angus. The historical significance is reflected in the major housing estate in Liff Village which bears its name.
